newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: SOCCER-10-MAN NEW ZEALAND CRUSHED BY SOCCEROOS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-10-MAN NEW ZEALAND CRUSHED BY SOCCEROOS.

text.p: Australia took a stranglehold on their World Cup Oceania zone play-off when they beat 10-man New Zealand 3-0 in the first leg on Saturday.
New Zealand played the final 23 minutes with 10 men after midfielder Chris Jackson was booked for a second time for a clumsy challenge on Ned Zelic.
The Socceroos, boasting a string of European-based professionals in their line-up, translated their superiority on paper on to the pitch.
They dominated the midfield through Zelic and Aurelio Vidmar, were full of running up front and rarely allowed New Zealand to threaten their goal.
Australia's opening goal in the 19th minute came after a defensive error, Craig Foster latching on to the loose ball to set up John Aloisi.

They were two up in the 42nd minute thanks to a fine strike by Vidmar from outside the penalty area. Foster made it 3-0 midway through the second half when he chipped New Zealand goalkeeper Jason Batty.
The return leg is in Sydney next Saturday, with the winners going on to face the fourth-ranked Asian nation for a place in the World Cup finals in France next year.
New Zealand - Jason Batty, Danny Hay, Ivan Vicelich, Gavin Wilkinson, Mark Atkinson, Simon Elliot, Michael McGarry, Chris Jackson, Riki van Steeden, Wynton Rufer, Vaughen Coveny.
Australia - Mark Bosnich, Craig Moore, Steve Horvat, Alex Tobin, Robbie Slater, Stan Lazaridis, Craig Foster, Ned Zelic, Aurelio Vidmar, Graham Arnold, John Aloisi.
